name: Timber Ridge Lodge & Waterpark

reviews.text: We wanted to take a weekend trip not far from home with our kids (3 & 4). Two other families came with us. The prices were very reasonable for the spacious suites. There was a full kitchen which as convenient for keeping some food for breakfast items, snacks and drinks. The water park was had lots of fun things to do for the younger kids including crafts and movies. My only recommendation for the resort would be to add more restaurants.
reviews.title: Great waterpark for families with young kids!

reviews.text: They did not provide the hours if operation for the water park. Come on, closed between 1-4 pm. That's when young kids are active. And the breakfast gift card is a joke! The hungry moose opens at 8am. Kids were hungry then
reviews.title: They did not provide the hours if...

reviews.text: We stayed at this resort for 3 nights, Friday 9/24 - Monday 9/27. Staying was myself, husband, 3 year old son and 4 month old son. We chose to stay because we had a great corporate rate - and my husband would be at meetings at Grand Geneva afterwards. Overall, I agree with what a lot of the reviews had said. True, this is no Wisconsin Dells indoor waterpark and as long as you go there expecting that - you shouldn't be disappointed with the pool area.
reviews.title: Overall, can't complain too much...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But to start more from the beginning...the setting is pretty - set in the country but also within a mile of Walmart, fast food, etc. We had a one bedroom countryside view suite which overlooked the parking lot and woods. The room itself was bigger than it looked in the pictures online. Had a nice kitchenette with breakfast bar, large bathroom with 2 person jacuzzi tub, table for 6, smaller living room with sofa/sofa bed pullout, and bedroom. So size was a plus for the most part. BUT, the bedroom itself was pretty small. It was tight getting the pack n play in, but it did fit - although we opted to keep it in the living area at night. Our biggest complaint about the living room was the tv placement. It was set so high up it was a strain on your neck to look at it. The fireplace was nice though. Also, there was a small, private balcony outside.
reviews.title: Great Get Away Spot

reviews.text: We set up the sofa bed but the mattress was SO thin and uncomfortable. Whether sitting on it or laying on it, you had a constant spring poking into you. I didn't even have the heart to have our 3 year old sleep on it. My other main complaints have to do with bedding also. They deliver the pack n play with a full size sheet wrapped around it. Someone should know that is NOT safe. I thought ahead and brought a sheet for it - but still, I would think sheets that fit would be something the hotel could invest in. The bed in the bedroom was comfortable as far as the mattress goes. But, the blankets made the bed feel like a super 8 bed. They were cheap, rough and flimsy. The pillows also were very flat (remedied by calling for extra). I put a lot of value on a comfy bed/pillows/etc and they missed the mark here.
reviews.title: Drive the extra hour to the Dells!!!

reviews.text: Great value & perfect for a family with small children. Nice, clean room. It was smallish but there was enough space to lounge if you're not at the waterpark. It was convenient to have the kitchenette so we didn't have to go out for every meal. The BBQ restaurant was a tad overpriced but the food was good and the servers were nice. The waterpark was great for families with young children.
reviews.title: Perfect for families with young children

reviews.text: My son and my sister and niece stayed at the resort for last week during week and got a great rate. While I had no probelm with the water park or staff, I did have a few issues with the room. The AC did not work properly. Service was called and an engineer came and looked at it. He said it was working fine but it didn't cool off the room completely even though it was set to 70 on thermostat. The fold away bed in the couch was awful and it slanted to left. The mattress was so thin that you could feel the springs. Also, the coffee maker was broken.
reviews.title: The waterpark was small but it was clean.

reviews.text: We decided to go to Timber Ridge because we have a one year old son who loves the water. We had been looking for a weekend getaway that would be appropriate for all three of us. This was perfect! The room was clean and spacious. We were able to put our son to bed in the separate bedroom and stay up. The kitchen came stocked with all of the pans, dishes and silverware that we needed. It was nice to be able to prepare our son's food. The water park was really nice, but more for younger children (a 12 yr. old would think it is for babies) There are only 2 slides and none of the pools are deeper than 4 feet. The food in Smokey's (bbq) was good. Pretty average for a bbq place. We got a pizza from the Hungry Moose and it was also good but average.
reviews.title: Great trip!

reviews.text: One of the best things was the in-room babysitters you can hire. They are expensive ($18/hour for 2 kids) but worth it. We went up to the Grand Geneva and had a couple of drinks while our son slept. It was great to have some adult time on the trip along with all of the family activities.
reviews.title: Great minivacation for people with young kids that love water!

reviews.text: This resort is very family oriented and you might hear kids running around but we did not find it disturbing. Everything was clean and pleasant. We had a great time and would recommend it to anyone!
reviews.title: Horrible room, rude staff

reviews.text: The rooms were spacious...gorgeous whirlpool tubs/fireplace. Equipped kitchens...saved alot on food! Waterpark...many choices for young to old...loved the 2 outdoor pools...esp early morning.... very quiet. Close to downtown Lake Geneva (3 min car ride) ...able to rent jet skis ..the lake was beautiful....Must do the ice cream boat tour of Lake Geneva!...Stables next door to hotel...Free trolly service to its sister hotel.... Great mini vacation!!
reviews.title: Great place for kids and adults

reviews.text: 18 of us stayed here for parent's 50th anniversary. Perfect setup for the entire group where all could do their own activities but still come together at the waterpark and for late night gatherings. Food service at Smokey's was too slow considering there were only two groups there. As others point out, sofa bed is miserable. Pillows on other bed leave much to be desired. But, all negatives outweighed by nice fitness center, waterpark activiites and convenient location for our primary Chicago-based group.
reviews.title: Perfect for our large group of adults and kids

reviews.text: Timber Ridge is close enough to the city yet far enough a way to make for a relaxing getaway. We traveled to Lake Geneva with our 2 year old son. We loved the one BR layout so our son could sleep in the bedroom while we watched TV, etc. The kitchenette was also convenient. The waterpark was great. I was expecting it to be bigger, but our son still like it. I was hoping there would be a larger regular pool, but that area was pretty small and the lazy river took up most of the space. My son loved the toddler area too.
reviews.title: Great escape from the city

reviews.text: When you're in the area make sure to stop by downtown Lake Geneva -- we went there in the morning for breakfast and a nice stroll along the lake. It's a very cute downtown area with lots of shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: This place not just for young kids. (Only 2 minor complaints!)

reviews.text: All in all, a great place to stay for families -- we're definitely planning to return.
reviews.title: Nice time

reviews.text: We stayed at Timber Ridge Christmas Eve, departing on Christmas Day. We were very pleased with the water park portion of the hotel and with the staff, all of whom went out of their way to be outgoing, accommodating and friendly. You can arrive and start using your water park passes at 1pm even though checkin technically isn't until 4. Your passes are also good for the whole next day, but checkout is at 11am so you need to store your luggage if you plan to stay and play.
reviews.title: Clean, friendly, good for families

reviews.text: The suite was large, comfortable and well-stocked with fluffy towels and kitchen necessities. There are 2 TVs and a remote control fireplace (gas).
reviews.title: Too much money for too little.

reviews.text: The only downsides to the hotel: slow elevators, uncomfortable convertible sofa bed, a freezing cold snack bar at the pool and the world's worst BBQ at the hotel restaurant, Smokey's. Seriously, DON'T EAT THERE. The ice cream and drinks and service are fine, but the food is appallingly bad.
reviews.title: Nice water park - horible rooms

reviews.text: I came with my family including two children aged 4 and 9. The water park was fine, like others I have been too. The game room did not have any games for small children and the others required no skill. The restaurant, Smokeys, was ribs, hamburger and pizza and was quite expensive. The other restaurants were at the nearby hotel and were poor quality food and very expensive - about $50 a person. We could get no information about other entertainment for children in the area, except some sledding, which was not very good. The internet connection was not wifi and I could not connect with by Macbook Air.
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.text: Our family (which includes two small children) and another family (with two small children) recently stayed at this hotel. While the indoor wter park was clean and the kids enjoyed it, both rooms were very dirty. The kitchen floors in both rooms were dirty/sticky from the previous guests and we found multiple bugs. We literally killed 13 bugs in our room over 2 days.
reviews.title: Great Relaxing Get Away with Friends and Family

aka: Timber Ridge Lodge & Waterpark Hotel Lake Geneva
